instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PBUS_G3H: What is PBUS_G3H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PBUS_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board quarter fan spin!
threads.message:
got this board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it has quarter fan spin , it spin for less then 1 sec then turn off... <SIGNAL>PBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is good, constant 8.5 v,


is it he issue with current sensing register?

i chked 

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL>


this coming and going off. whenit come for 1/10 sec fan spin for .05 sec...


is there is caps shot!!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board quarter fan spin!
threads.message: come on, put some effort!!!!!!  Where is water damage?? Check SPI resistors and lines.... Is in on-off loop??

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board quarter fan spin!
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 3658"]come on, put some effort!!!!!! Where is water damage?? Check SPI resistors and lines.... Is in on-off loop??[/QUOTE]
some one really cleaned the before i got it, which one SPI resistor? could give all possible hint ... thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board quarter fan spin!
threads.message: First check voltage on Y2705, it should not spike over 1.6V when in power cycles. Then check resistors from SPI chip <RESISTOR>R5110</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R5120</RESISTOR> and the rest around that area.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board quarter fan spin!
threads.message:
around spi chip one register was missing, after changing  that it quater fan spin gone!!!! 

but ... its turns on when i apply 16v from my bench power supply to the board ,  

if i connect magsafe there is no green light board does not turn on, on dcin rail i see only 2v..... when i put 16 v in same rail board turn on nicely,   i also put a new dc in board but no luck...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board quarter fan spin!
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board quarter fan spin!
threads.message:
solved!!!
im a FUCKING STUPID ,, I REPEAT IM A FUCKING STUPID.......     see last post i said no power!!!!!!........ here what i did when doughter board was open (out of case) i was trying with magsafe 2.... but this is 2012, use magsafe 1.... and i was trying 2 days..... my all hair is gray already ......


<RESISTOR>R5120</RESISTOR> was missing ..that why quater fan spanning ....now everything works perfectly


dulefawks you are awesome . thanks again
